contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Hoshino'''|星野村|Hoshino-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Yame District, Fukuoka|Yame District]], [[Fukuoka Prefecture|Fukuoka]], [[Japan]]. On February 1, 2010 Hoshino, along with the towns of [[Kurogi, Fukuoka|Kurogi]] and [[Tachibana, Fukuoka|Tachibana]] and the village of [[Yabe, Fukuoka|Yabe]], all from Yame District, were merged into the city of [[Yame, Fukuoka|Yame]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 3,707 and a [[population density|density]] of 45.61 persons per km². The total area was {{convert|81.28|km²|0|abbr=on}}. ==External links== * [http://www.city.yame.fukuoka.jp/ Yame official website] {{ja icon}} {{coord|33|15|N|130|46|E|region:JP_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Fukuoka Prefecture]] [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2010]] {{Fukuoka-geo-stub}}
